new_ticket.name: shubham
new_ticket.description: showing blue screen on laptop and two  - three options  are showing troubleshoot and other options
new_ticket.title: blue screen error on laptop

extracted_metadata.user_actions: Unknown (not specified in the ticket description)

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Restart your laptop. The blue screen error might be a one-time issue that can be resolved by restarting the device.
2. If the blue screen appears again after restarting, take note of the error messages displayed on the screen. These messages can help in identifying the specific problem.
3. Press the Windows key + I to open Settings, then click on Update & Security.
4. Click on Recovery on the left side of the window, and under Advanced startup, click Restart now.
5. After your PC restarts to the Choose an option screen, click on Troubleshoot.
6. Click on Advanced options, then select Startup Repair.
7. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the Startup Repair process.
8. If Startup Repair is not available or does not resolve the issue, try performing a System Restore. To do this, go back to the Advanced options screen (step 5), then click on System Restore.
9. Choose a restore point from the list, then follow the on-screen instructions to complete the System Restore process.

If the blue screen error persists after following these steps, please provide the noted error messages and any additional information to IT support for further assistance.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

new_ticket.name: shubh
new_ticket.description: outlook is able to launch properly
new_ticket.title: outlook is not working

extracted_metadata.error_messages: No specific error message mentioned, but Outlook is able to launch properly
extracted_metadata.resolution_indicators: Potential resolution approaches: troubleshooting Outlook configuration, checking for software updates

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Check for Outlook updates. To do this, open Outlook, click on "File" in the top left corner, then select "Office Account" or "Help" (depending on your version). Look for the "Update Options" button and click on it, then choose "Update Now". Install any available updates and restart Outlook.
2. Troubleshoot your Outlook configuration by resetting your profile. In Outlook, click on "File" > "Account Settings" > "Manage Profiles". Click on "Show Profiles", then "Add", and create a new profile with your email address and password. Set this new profile as the default and restart Outlook.

If the issue persists after following these steps, please reply to the support ticket with an update.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DB083B.A2907370]

similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

We can’t have this, and we can’t seem to get it right which is very frustrating.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> we need to have a manual follow up system after we send LOI out via phone and/or text to confirm they have received it and sent if we have not heard from them.

Please review and advise.

Best Regards,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

new_ticket.name: Ganesh
new_ticket.description: keyboard is not working properly it not responding sometimes.
new_ticket.title: keyboard is not working

extracted_metadata.resolution_indicators: Hardware or software issue with the keyboard

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Try restarting your computer. Sometimes, a simple restart can fix keyboard issues.
2. If the keyboard is a USB model, unplug it and then plug it back in to ensure it's properly connected.
3. Test the keyboard by typing in a simple text editor or notepad to see if the "not responding" issue persists.
4. If the problem continues, try using an external keyboard to determine if the issue is with the built-in keyboard or a USB port.
5. If the external keyboard works without issues, consider updating the keyboard drivers. You can usually find the latest drivers on the manufacturer's website.
6. If updating drivers doesn't help, try booting your computer in Safe Mode. If the keyboard works normally in Safe Mode, it's likely that a third-party software is causing the conflict.
7. In this case, try uninstalling recently installed software or performing a system restore to a point when the keyboard was working properly.
8. If the keyboard still doesn't work, there might be a hardware issue. Contact your IT department or the keyboard manufacturer's support for further assistance.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DB083B.A2907370]

similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

We can’t have this, and we can’t seem to get it right which is very frustrating.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> we need to have a manual follow up system after we send LOI out via phone and/or text to confirm they have received it and sent if we have not heard from them.

Please review and advise.

Best Regards,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Re: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

As an alternative, we could set up an email notification to Jason with all
the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

MARKETING STRATEGIST
 <https://www.mybizniche.com/>
www.mybizniche.com
Direct: 480-351-7071 <4803517071>
Office: 480-977-6444 <4809776444>
TravisSchenck@mybizniche.com <travisschenck@mybizniche.com>
16100 N. Greenway-Hayden Loop,
Ste F150, Scottsdale, AZ 85260



On Wed, Sep 18, 2024 at 2:39?PM Dan Garzella <dan@garzellagroup.com> wrote:

> Hi Travis,
>
>
>
> Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to
> trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice
> to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going
> out instead of having it be manual.
>
>
>
> So effectively, it should be:
>
>
>
> “Letter of Intent Signed”
>
> “Invoice Sent/Received”
>
> “Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”
>
>
>
> In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative
> would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in
> order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce
> Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.
>
>
>
> @Carly Garzella <carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.
>
>
>
> Thanks,
>
>

new_ticket.name: john wick
new_ticket.description: when i try to connect company wifi  at that time i am not able to connect to wifi
new_ticket.title: network issus

extracted_metadata.user_actions: Trying to connect to company WiFi
extracted_metadata.resolution_indicators: Check WiFi settings, restart router or modem

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Check the WiFi settings on your device. Make sure that the WiFi is turned on and you are trying to connect to the correct network (Company WiFi).
2. Verify the network name (SSID) and password you are entering. Ensure there are no typos or extra spaces.
3. If you're near the router, try restarting your device to see if it resolves the connectivity issue.
4. Lastly, try restarting the router or modem. Unplug the power cord, wait for about 30 seconds, then plug it back in. It may take a few minutes for the router to fully restart and reconnect to the internet.

After following these steps, attempt to connect to the Company WiFi again. If you still encounter issues, please reply to the support ticket with an update.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DB083B.A2907370]
[cid:image002.png@01DB083B.A2907370]

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Re: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

As an alternative, we could set up an email notification to Jason with all
the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

> Hi Travis,
>
>
>
> Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to
> trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice
> to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going
> out instead of having it be manual.
>
>
>

>
>

> order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce
> Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

new_ticket.name: raj  sharma
new_ticket.description: outlook is not able to launch properly sometimes it stuck and will not work.
new_ticket.title: outlook is not working properly

extracted_metadata.error_messages: Sometimes stuck and will not work
extracted_metadata.resolution_indicators: Possible fix: restarting Outlook or checking for software updates

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Attempt to close Outlook completely if it is currently open.
2. Reopen Outlook and see if the issue has been resolved.
3. If Outlook still does not work properly, click on the 'File' tab within Outlook.
4. From the left-hand side menu, select 'Office Account' or 'Help' (depending on your version of Outlook).
5. A new window will appear, click on 'Update Options' and then 'Update Now'. This will check for any available software updates.
6. If an update is available, follow the prompts to install it.
7. Once the update is installed, restart Outlook and check if it is now working correctly.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DB083B.A2907370]
[cid:image002.png@01DB083B.A2907370]

similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

We can’t have this, and we can’t seem to get it right which is very frustrating.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> we need to have a manual follow up system after we send LOI out via phone and/or text to confirm they have received it and sent if we have not heard from them.

Please review and advise.

Best Regards,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

As an alternative, we could set up an email notification to Jason with all
the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

new_ticket.name: raj
new_ticket.description: ms office is not responding properly
new_ticket.title: MS office is not working

extracted_metadata.error_messages: ms office is not responding properly
extracted_metadata.resolution_indicators: Possible resolution: software update, restart, or troubleshooting

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Check for Microsoft Office updates. To do this, open any Office application (like Word or Excel), then click on "File" in the top left corner. From there, select "Account" and look for the "Update Options" button. Click on it and choose "Update Now."

2. If updates are available, allow them to install and restart your computer. After the restart, try opening Microsoft Office again to see if the issue is resolved.

3. If there were no updates or the issue persists after updating, try restarting the Office application. Click on the "X" button in the top right corner of the application to close it, then reopen the application and try using it again.

4. If the problem continues, perform troubleshooting on Microsoft Office. To do this, close all Office applications, then press the Windows key + I to open "Settings." In the settings window, click on "Update & Security" and then select "Troubleshoot" from the left-hand menu. Scroll down and click on "Microsoft Office" and then "Run the troubleshooter." Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the troubleshooting process.

5. After troubleshooting, restart your computer and try opening Microsoft Office again to see if the issue is resolved. If the problem persists, consider reaching out to IT support for further assistance.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DB083B.A2907370]

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

We can’t have this, and we can’t seem to get it right which is very frustrating.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> we need to have a manual follow up system after we send LOI out via phone and/or text to confirm they have received it and sent if we have not heard from them.

Please review and advise.

Best Regards,

Travis Schenck

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Re: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

As an alternative, we could set up an email notification to Jason with all
the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

new_ticket.title: ms office is not working

extracted_metadata.main_issue: MS Office is not working properly
extracted_metadata.resolution_indicators: Workarounds available, possibly related to software configuration or compatibility issues

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Restart Microsoft Office: Close all Office applications and reopen them to see if the issue is resolved.
2. Check for updates: Make sure your Microsoft Office is up-to-date by going to File > Account > Update Options > Update Now.
3. Try running in compatibility mode: Open the problematic Office document, click on File > Info > Check for Issues > Check Compatibility.
4. Disable add-ins: Go to File > Options > Add-ins, then select 'COM Add-ins' from the 'Manage' dropdown and click 'Go'. Uncheck any add-ins you don't need and click 'OK'.
5. Change default program settings: Right-click a Office file, select 'Open with' > 'Choose another app', then choose a different Microsoft Office program and check the box 'Always use this app to open .<file_extension> files'.
6. Reinstall Microsoft Office: If none of the above steps work, consider uninstalling and reinstalling Microsoft Office.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

new_ticket.name: rohan
new_ticket.description: on my pc it showing the blue screen error and it is restarting it
new_ticket.title: blue screen error

extracted_metadata.resolution_indicators: System restart, possible driver or software issue

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Save any open files and close all applications on your PC.
2. Click on the Start menu or press the Windows key on your keyboard.
3. Select the Power icon and then click on Restart.
4. After your PC has restarted, check if the blue screen error reoccurs.
5. If the issue persists, try updating your drivers and software:
    a. Click on the Start menu or press the Windows key.
    b. Type "Device Manager" in the search bar and open it.
    c. Look for any devices with a yellow exclamation mark next to them.
    d. Right-click on the device and select "Update driver."
    e. Follow the prompts to update the driver.
    f. Repeat steps c-e for all devices with a yellow exclamation mark.
6. If the problem continues, consider checking for Windows updates:
    a. Click on the Start menu or press the Windows key.
    b. Type "Check for updates" in the search bar and open it.
    c. Click on "Check for updates" and install any available updates.
    d. Restart your PC and check if the blue screen error has been resolved.

If the blue screen error persists after following these steps, please create a new support ticket with additional information about the issue.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,

similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

We can’t have this, and we can’t seem to get it right which is very frustrating.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> we need to have a manual follow up system after we send LOI out via phone and/or text to confirm they have received it and sent if we have not heard from them.

Please review and advise.

Best Regards,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

new_ticket.name: rohan
new_ticket.description: touch pad is not  support sometimes  and  sometimes it stuck there
new_ticket.title: touch pad is not working

extracted_metadata.error_messages: Sometimes it's not supported, and sometimes it gets stuck
extracted_metadata.resolution_indicators: Restarting the touch pad or updating drivers might resolve the issue

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Shut down your computer completely.
2. Wait for about 30 seconds to allow the system to fully shut off.
3. Turn on your computer again.
4. Once you're at the desktop, try using the touchpad to see if it's working now.
5. If the touchpad is still not working, update the touchpad drivers:
    a. Right-click the Start button and select "Device Manager" from the context menu.
    b. In the Device Manager window, find and expand the "Mice and other pointing devices" category.
    c. Locate your touchpad device in the list (it might be labeled as "Synaptics," "Elan," or something similar).
    d. Right-click the touchpad device and select "Update driver" from the context menu.
    e. Choose "Search automatically for updated driver software" and follow the on-screen instructions to complete the driver update process.
    f. Restart your computer after the update is complete.
6. Test the touchpad again to see if it's now working correctly. If you still encounter issues, please reply to the support ticket with detailed information about the problem.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DB083B.A2907370]

similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

We can’t have this, and we can’t seem to get it right which is very frustrating.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> we need to have a manual follow up system after we send LOI out via phone and/or text to confirm they have received it and sent if we have not heard from them.

Please review and advise.

Best Regards,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Re: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

As an alternative, we could set up an email notification to Jason with all
the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

MARKETING STRATEGIST
 <https://www.mybizniche.com/>
www.mybizniche.com
Direct: 480-351-7071 <4803517071>
Office: 480-977-6444 <4809776444>
TravisSchenck@mybizniche.com <travisschenck@mybizniche.com>
16100 N. Greenway-Hayden Loop,
Ste F150, Scottsdale, AZ 85260



On Wed, Sep 18, 2024 at 2:39?PM Dan Garzella <dan@garzellagroup.com> wrote:

> Hi Travis,
>
>
>
> Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to
> trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice
> to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going
> out instead of having it be manual.
>
>
>
> So effectively, it should be:
>
>
>
> “Letter of Intent Signed”
>
> “Invoice Sent/Received”
>
> “Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”
>
>
>
> In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative
> would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in
> order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce
> Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.
>
>
>
> @Carly Garzella <carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.
>
>
>
> Thanks,
>
>

new_ticket.name: Ram
new_ticket.title: ms office not working properly

extracted_metadata.technical_keywords: MS Office, Office Suite, productivity software
extracted_metadata.user_actions: Unknown (not specified in the ticket description)
extracted_metadata.resolution_indicators: Possible resolution approaches: troubleshooting, software update, or reinstall

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Check if Microsoft Office is currently running on your system. If it is, try closing and reopening the application.
2. Attempt to open another Office program (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint) to see if the issue is specific to one application or system-wide.
3. Restart your computer and try opening Microsoft Office again to see if the problem has been resolved.
4. If the issue persists, ensure that your system meets the necessary requirements for Microsoft Office by visiting the official Microsoft website.
5. Run the Microsoft Office built-in repair tool:
   a. Open the Control Panel.
   b. Select "Programs and Features" or "Add or Remove Programs."
   c. Find Microsoft Office in the list, right-click it, and select "Change."
   d. Choose "Quick Repair" and follow the on-screen instructions.
6. If the problem continues, install any available updates for Microsoft Office:
   a. Open any Microsoft Office application (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
   b. Click the "File" tab.
   c. Select "Account" or "Help."
   d. Check for updates and install any available updates.
7. If the issue remains unresolved, consider uninstalling and reinstalling Microsoft Office:
   a. Follow the steps in #5 to open the "Change" window for Microsoft Office.
   b. Choose "Uninstall" and confirm the action.
   c. Restart your computer.
   d. Download and reinstall Microsoft Office from the official Microsoft website.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DB083B.A2907370]

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

Please review and advise.

Best Regards,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Re: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

As an alternative, we could set up an email notification to Jason with all
the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

>
>
>

new_ticket.name: ganesh
new_ticket.description: i am not able to connect the wifi properly it fluctuate and sometimes it disconnect
new_ticket.title: network connectivity error

extracted_metadata.resolution_indicators: Check WiFi settings, restart router, or troubleshoot network configuration

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Check your WiFi settings on your device. Make sure you're connected to the correct network.
2. Try restarting your device. This can sometimes resolve temporary connectivity issues.
3. Turn off your device's WiFi, wait for a few seconds, then turn it back on. This can help re-establish a stable connection.
4. Restart your router. Unplug the power cord, wait for about 30 seconds, then plug it back in. Wait for the router to fully restart before trying to reconnect.
5. If you're still experiencing a fluctuating connection, try forgetting the network on your device and reconnecting. You can usually do this in your WiFi settings.
6. If the problem persists, check if other devices are also experiencing the same issue. If they are, the problem might be with your network configuration or your Internet Service Provider (ISP).
7. If the issue is with your network configuration, consider resetting your router to its factory settings. Please note that this will erase all custom settings and you will need to reconfigure your network.
8. If none of the above steps work, contact your ISP for further assistance.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DB083B.A2907370]

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

We can’t have this, and we can’t seem to get it right which is very frustrating.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> we need to have a manual follow up system after we send LOI out via phone and/or text to confirm they have received it and sent if we have not heard from them.

Please review and advise.

Best Regards,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Re: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

As an alternative, we could set up an email notification to Jason with all
the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

> Hi Travis,
>
>
>
> Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to
> trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice
> to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going
> out instead of having it be manual.
>
>
>
> So effectively, it should be:
>
>

>
> “Invoice Sent/Received”

>
>

> order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce
> Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

>
